page.title: 18The beach, Pevensey Bay.
page.content: Pevensey Bay is an area of sheltered water protected from the prevailing SW winds by Beachy Head and the South Downs.The beach consists of{gently {shelving shingle}extending down to{ {firm sand uncovered at low tide}Wooden groynes,or break waters,extend down the shingle at about 25 yard intervals They retain the shingle which would otherwise be carried away by the incoming tide and deposited at Dungeness nearly 30 miles to the East. Many of the{holiday bungalows}along the top of the beach,owners claiming their own private beach down to the mean high tide line,are used in winter as well as summer.The sheltered position on the South coast gives a very pleasant temperature and a large amount of winter sunshine;fog and snow are rare,rainfall is 25% bellow average.
